stimulusHtml: Which of the following best describes an important effect of the transatlantic slave trade on the culture of the United States?

features.html:
• In the foreground are several African people on the shore of a large body of water showing various states of distress.
  • In the middle ground are several African people, also showing distress, in a rowboat being rowed away from the shore.
  • In the right background is a large sailing ship preparing to sail away from the shore.

Chambon, M. Marché d’esclaves, 1764, Engraving, Courtesy of Slavery Images: A Visual Record of the African Slave Trade and Slave Life in the Early African Diaspora. http://www.slaveryimages.org/s/slaveryimages/item/1983.

choicesHtml: The transatlantic slave trade limited enslaved African Americans’ cultural contributions to the fields of music and the performing arts.
The transatlantic slave trade led to the widespread adoption of West African languages such as Wolof, Akan, and Yoruba by the majority of the enslaved population of the United States.

The transatlantic slave trade contributed to a significant cultural diversity among enslaved African Americans due to the multiple combinations of African beliefs and practices in various communities.
The transatlantic slave trade prevented enslaved African Americans from maintaining cultural practices and beliefs.
